required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY900014 and Insulin Degludec in Participants With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study Assessing Time in Target Glucose Range Using a New Titration Scheme of LY900014 and Insulin Degludec in Patients With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, participants with type 1 diabetes (T1D) will take the study drug LY900014 and insulin degludec. The reason for this study is to evaluate the amount of time with glucose values within target range.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Time with Sensor Glucose Values Between 70 and 180 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) with Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of Time with Sensor Glucose Values Between 70 and 180 mg/dL (both inclusive) with CGM

arm_group.description: LY9000014 and insulin degludec given subcutaneously (SC).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must have type 1 diabetes and have been treated with insulin therapy for at least 1 year
- Participants must be using Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) with total CGM use â‰¥ 2 months in the prior 6 months
- Participants must have been on the same type of short acting insulin (Humalog U-100, Novolog, Admelog, or Apidra) for at least 30 days prior to screening
- Participants must have been treated with long-acting insulin degludec U-100 for at least 30 days prior to screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants must not have had more than 1 emergency room visit or hospitalization due to poor glucose control within 6 months before screening
- Participants must not have had more than 1 episode of severe hypoglycemia within the last 90 days prior to screening
- Participants must not be taking certain diabetes medications that are not allowed for study participation

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

link.description: A Study of LY900014 and Insulin Degludec in Participants With Type 1 Diabetes.

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
